_header: Now fairest of stature formed by nature
_description: The lover’s appeal to his mistress for mercy — four stanzas rhyme royal

BLCottVesDIX.First Lines: Now fayreste of stature formyd by natureof beaute the merrour and grond of gentylnes…
BLCottVesDIX.Last Lines: …The xvj day of the month of stedfastnysThe xxiij yere of polycy and southnes
BLCottVesDIX.Note: Begins without break or indication of new text, as if continuing 1236.
BLCottVesDIX.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Secular Lyrics of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         2nd ed. Oxford: Clarendon, 1955: 201-2.
